contentrichtext.text: {{Taxobox | fossil_range = [[Oligocene]] - [[Holocene]] | image = | image_width = | image_caption = | regnum = [[Animal]]ia | phylum = [[Chordata]] | classis = [[Mammal]]ia | ordo = [[Pilosa]] | subordo = [[Folivora]] <small>(''partim'')</small> | superfamilia = †[[Orophodontoidea]] | familia = | subdivision_ranks = [[Genus (biology)|Genera]] | subdivision = *see text }} '''Orophodontidae''' is a [[family (biology)|family]] of extinct [[ground sloths]] within the order [[Pilosa]] and suborder [[Folivora]]. The taxon is often '''disused''' with genus members reassigned.<ref>[http://paleodb.org/cgi-bin/bridge.pl?action=checkTaxonInfo&taxon_no=53701&is_real_user=1 Paleobiology Database: Orophodontidae].</ref> This family is related to the other families of extinct ground sloths, [[Megatheriidae]], [[Mylodontidae]], [[Nothrotheriidae]], and [[Scelidotheriidae]]. The only extant families of the suborder Folivora are [[Bradypodidae]] and [[Megalonychidae]]. The orophodontids constitute a rather small but quite distinct group. They are classified as a distinct [[mylodonta]]n [[Taxonomic rank|superfamily]] '''Orophodontoidea''', the [[sister taxon]] to the [[Mylodontoidea]].
